pullrequest.title: Logging speed improvement: add zlib option for compression (fix #682)

content.html:
I was adding this test (thanks @iche033) to our test suite and tried a slightly modified and evil version, not sure if it makes sense:

TEST(logrecord_stress, StartStopStressing)
{
  gazebo::util::LogRecord *recorder = gazebo::util::LogRecord::Instance();
  EXPECT_TRUE(recorder->Init("test"));

  for (int j = 0; j < 100; ++j)
  {
    EXPECT_TRUE(recorder->Start());
    recorder->Stop();
  }
}

Sometimes is failing (gdb overhead is making it to work so no bracktrace) with the message:

Running main() from gtest_main.cc
[==========] Running 1 test from 1 test case.
[----------] Global test environment set-up.
[----------] 1 test from logrecord_stress
[ RUN      ] logrecord_stress.StartStopStressing
[       OK ] logrecord_stress.StartStopStressing (10 ms)
[----------] 1 test from logrecord_stress (10 ms total)

[----------] Global test environment tear-down
[==========] 1 test from 1 test case ran. (11 ms total)
[  PASSED  ] 1 test.
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'boost::exception_detail::clone_impl<boost::exception_detail::error_info_injector<boost::lock_error> >'
  what():  boost::lock_error
